info.question: Which S3 service automatically checks the replication status of S3 objects across different regions, providing near real-time metrics as well as failure notifications?
S3 Lifecycle Management can be used in conjunction with versioning?
S3 Lifecycle Management can be applied to current versions but not previous versions?
answers: false, it can be applied to both current versions and previous versions
false, it cannot be applied to either
correctAnswer: false, it can be applied to both current versions and previous versions

info.question: With S3 Lifecycle Management rules you can do which of these?
answers: Transition to the Standard Infrequent Access storage class
Archive to the Glacier storage class
Transition to the One Zone Infrequent Access storage class
Transition to the Reduced Redundancy storage class
correctAnswer: Transition to the Standard Infrequent Access storage class
Archive to the Glacier storage class
Transition to the One Zone Infrequent Access storage class

info.question: With S3 Lifecycle Management rules when you transition to the Standard Infrequent Access storage class the object must be _________?
answers: at least 128kb in size and 30 days after creation date
at least 64kb in size and 30 days after creation date
at least 128kb in size and 60 days after creation date
correctAnswer: at least 128kb in size and 30 days after creation date

info.question: With S3 Lifecycle Management rules when you transition to the Glacier storage class the object must be _________?
answers: 30 days after transitioning to the Infrequent Access storage class or 60 days after creation date
60 days after transitioning to the Infrequent Access storage class or 90 days after creation date
at least 128kb in size and 60 days after creation date
correctAnswer: 30 days after transitioning to the Infrequent Access storage class or 60 days after creation date

info.question: ________ is a system of distributed servers (network) that deliver webpages and other web content to a user based on the geographic locations of the user, the origin of the web page, and the content delivery server?
________ is a the location where content will be cached, which is separate to an AWS Region or AZ?
________ is a the origin of all the files that the CDN will distribute?
The origin of the files that the CDN will distribute can be which of these?
________ is a the name given to the CDN which consists of a colection of Edge Locations?
With CloudFront, requests for your content are automatically routed to the ________, so content is delivered with the best possible performance?
CloudFront is NOT used to deliver which of the following?
CloudFront is optimized to work with which of these?
CloudFront works seamlessly with Non-AWS origin servers?
This type of CloudFront distribution is typically used for websites?
This type of CloudFront distribution is typically used for media streaming?
There are over _____ Edge Locations around the world?
Edge Locations are not just read only; you can write to them as well (ie. put an object on them)?
Objects are cached in Edge Locations for the life of the _____?
You can clear objects out of the Edge Locations?
If you explicitly clear objects from your Edge Locations cache you will NOT be charged by AWS?
